mods:mods.mods:abstract: Was very anxious on hearing of his brother FrederickÆs illness, but approves his plan of not taking medicine. æTemperance, exercise and attention to dietÆ improved his own health after having a complaint for two years. If God spares his life, he will be with his brother next spring without fail. NancyÆs illness is very upsetting, but is glad Peter continues in good health. Has received Frederick JayÆs letter of attorney and will take care of that business. Thanks for taking care of his son Peter Jay and believes he should stay at Elizabeth until plans can be made for his education. Has asked Peter Munro to value the farm at Rye and take it at that valuation; has spoken to Mr. Benson about it as well. Would like FrederickÆs opinion. Sir James Jay is also in France but does not come near the Jays; mystified as to his continued presence there. Believes Fady acted rightly in his correspondence with Kitty (Catherine) Livingston, about Mr. M-. Expect a new niece or nephew next month. Has heard dry goods are cheaper in the United States than in France; now that peace has come has the opportunity of sending things but wonÆt. If there are financial problems, JJ will take care of his family as long as he is able.
